raw_comment:
1. We notice that the higher income the student they have significantly higher chance of being accepted into a college. Also if their parents have attended the college too, they also have a higher chance of getting accepted.
2. We wonder why do colleges find money so much more valuable than knowledge?
3. This related to us and our community because we will be competing with people of wealth and priority for college acceptance.
4. Have Valor kids ever truly been accepted?
ace_sentences: A student can have a higher income.
If a student has a higher income then the student has a significantly higher chance of being accepted into a college.
A parent of a student can have attended a college.
If a parent of a student has attended the college then the student has a higher chance of being accepted into the college.
We wonder why colleges find money more valuable than knowledge.
This situation relates to our community.
We will compete for college acceptance.
We will compete with people of wealth for college acceptance.
We will compete with people of priority for college acceptance.
A kid can be a Valor kid.
We ask whether a Valor kid has ever truly been accepted.
